The headline and source of the claim: The expert's verdict highlights that the claim originated from an article published by One America News (OAN) on March 7, 2021. OAN, known as a favorite news network of former President Donald Trump, has been previously suspended from YouTube for spreading false information about Covid-19.
Spread of the claim on social media: The expert's verdict mentions that the article from OAN has been shared on social media platforms as a screenshot and a link. The claim has also been observed in similar forms on various online platforms, indicating its wider circulation.
Reference to CDC research: The claim refers to a study conducted by the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The expert's verdict highlights that the study examined county-level data on mask mandates and restaurant reopenings, comparing them with changes in Covid-19 case and death growth rates. The study found statistically significant reductions in Covid-19 case and death growth rates associated with mask mandates.
Statements from CDC officials: The expert's verdict includes statements from a CDC spokeswoman, Dr Gery Guy (one of the study's authors), and CDC Director Dr Rochelle Walensky. These statements clarify that the study did examine the effectiveness of masks and found that mask mandates were associated with significant decreases in Covid-19 case and death growth rates. The statements contradict the claim made by OAN, emphasizing the importance of accurate information.
